parameters.definition: Amount of regular candy in each kilogram of the regular mix
Amount of sour candy in each kilogram of the regular mix
Profit per kilogram of the regular mix
Amount of regular candy in each kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Amount of sour candy in each kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Profit per kilogram of the sour surprise mix
Total amount of regular candy available
Total amount of sour candy available

description: A candy store mixes regular candy and sour candy to prepare two products, regular mix and sour surprise mix. Each kilogram of the regular mix contains \param{RegCandyRegMix} kg of regular candy and \param{SourCandyRegMix} kg of sour candy. The profit per kilogram of the regular mix is $\param{ProfitRegMix}. Each kilogram of the sour surprise mix contains \param{RegCandySourMix} kg of regular candy and \param{SourCandySourMix} kg of sour candy. The profit per kilogram of the sour surprise mix is $\param{ProfitSourMix}. The candy store has \param{TotalRegCandy} kg of regular candy and \param{TotalSourCandy} kg of sour candy available. How many kilograms of each type of candy mix should be created to maximize profits?
